alert.note: Alert for Kuskokwim Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 5:43AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS WITH ELEVATED WATER LEVELS POSSIBLE FRIDAY EVENING THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING ALONG THE NORTHERN KUSKOKWIM BAY COAST... Gale force southeasterly winds with gusts to 50 mph will increase Friday afternoon as a strong storm system moves into the eastern Bering. The strong winds are expected result in elevated water levels with the potential for water pushing up through cracks in the ice and ice pushing up on shore along south facing shorelines. The greatest chance for elevated water levels and potential ice shoves is expected to be along the Northern Kuskokwim Bay coast from Kipnuk east to Kongiganak. Water levels may rise to between 3 and 5 feet above normal highest tide by Friday evening through Saturday morning. Residents with interests along the coast should move items well above the normal high tide line.
